{{Open doors}} |attack1=10 ({{Hit type}}: {{Plain flavour}}) |attack2= |attack3= |attack4= |hit_dice=7 |base_hp=3 |extra_hp=5 |fixed_hp=0 |intelligence={{High intelligence}} |genus=dwarf |species=deep dwarf }} {{list of | deep dwarves}} {{Flavour|An evil deep dwarf that has sold its mortal soul in exchange for mastery of the occult arts of death and pain.}} ==Useful Info== '''Deep dwarf necromancers''' are one of the less dangerous of the [[deep dwarf (monster)|deep dwarves]], packing an arsenal of mid-level [[Necromancy]] spells and little else. Like all deep dwarves, they do not regenerate health naturally. They are occasionally found in the packs of deep dwarves roaming [[the Abyss]] or in certain endings of [[the Crypt]]. ==Spells== {{Spellcaster |number= |slot1=[[Pain]] (d11) |slot2=[[Dispel Undead]] (3d14) |slot3=[[Simulacrum]] |slot4=[[Vampiric Draining]] |slot5=[[Agony]] |slot6=[[Vampiric Draining]] }} {{clear}} ==Tips & Tricks== Any ranks of [[negative energy]] resistance will block all of their attack spells... unless you're [[undead]], in which case Dispel Undead packs a decent punch. If they manage to make [[simulacrum (monster)|simulacra]] of a decent monster, those could also cause you trouble. ==History== Deep dwarf necromancers were removed in [[0.13]].
